conversation_flow.subject: Re: meetings with external providers
conversation_flow.body:
Hi Steve,

Please confirm the updated time and date for the meeting with Jade regarding your recent accusations of insubordination.
I would like to ensure that all claims and examples you are referring to are clearly presented, as I am not aware of having acted in a way that warrants such a label.
I believe it's important we avoid misunderstandings and address any concerns with transparency.
From our last conversation prior to the meeting with Shane, I believed we were aligned in working collaboratively.
However, the current working environment-marked by what feels like targeted oversight-has become increasingly tense and counterproductive.
It is affecting my ability to perform effectively in the role I was hired for, and is taking a significant mental toll.
If there were genuine concerns of insubordination, I would have appreciated being informed at the time, which would have allowed for a constructive and good-faith resolution.
Looking forward to your response.
conversation_flow.body_summary: D. Delacruz replies requesting confirmation of the meeting (now involving J. Masigan) regarding 'accusations of insubordination'. Delacruz requests specific examples, states unawareness of actions warranting the label, and calls for transparency. He references prior perceived collaborative alignment but describes the current environment as 'targeted oversight,' 'tense,' 'counterproductive,' affecting performance, and causing 'significant mental toll'. He states concerns should have been addressed earlier for constructive resolution.
conversation_flow.body_JA:
スティーブさん、

先日あなたが主張された職務命令違反の件に関して、ジェイドさんとの会議の更新された日時を確認してください。
そのようなレッテルを貼られるような行動をとった覚えがないため、あなたが言及しているすべての主張と例が明確に提示されることを確実にしたいと思います。
誤解を避け、懸念事項を透明性をもって対処することが重要だと考えています。
シェーンさんとの会議前の最後の会話から、私たちは協力して働くことで一致していると信じていました。
しかし、標的を絞った監視のように感じられる現在の労働環境は、ますます緊張し、逆効果になっています。
これは私が雇われた役割で効果的に遂行する能力に影響を与えており、重大な精神的負担となっています。
もし職務命令違反に関する真の懸念があったのであれば、その時点で知らされていれば、建設的かつ誠実な解決が可能だったでしょう。
お返事お待ちしております。

conversation_flow.subject: Heartists Communication Meeting - April 24
conversation_flow.body:
Dear Heartists,

We'd like to invite you to the Heartists Communication Meeting on April 24th. Please show your support for your team division's presentation.

Here's how it works:

Choose Your Netflix Hit: Each Division will select a favorite Netflix movie or series as the inspiration for their performance.
Get Creative! Think catchy tunes, dazzling costumes, and dynamic choreography.
Teamwork Makes the Dream Work: Each Division needs at least 6 performers to bring their creative vision to life.
Showtime! Each Division will have 10 minutes in total for their regular updates and 3-5 minutes to wow the audience with their performance.
Judging Criteria:
Entertainment Value: 35% (How much fun we have watching you)
Creativity & Originality: 35% (How unique and impressive your costumes, music, and overall performance are.)
Stage Presence: 30% (Your confidence, energy, and ability to rock the stage)

Grab your popcorn and don't miss out this must-see event. See you there!

親愛なるハーティストの皆様へ、

4月24日に開催される ハーティストコミュニケーションミーティングにご招待します!
ぜひご自身の部門の発表を応援しながら、素晴らしいパフォーマンスを楽しみましょう。

イベント概要:

Netflix作品を選ぼう!: 各部門が、お気に入りの Netflix映画またはシリーズよりテーマを選びます
想像力を発揮!: キャッチーな音楽、華やかな衣装、ダイナミックな振り付けで表現してください。
チームワークが鍵!: 各部門6名以上のパフォーマーが必要です。
ショータイム!: 合計10分間の部門発表があります。通常の各部門最新情報に加え、3~5分間のパフォーマンスで観客を魅了してください。

審査基準:

エンターテイメント性: 35% (観客をどれだけ楽しませたか。)
• 創造性&独自性:35%(衣装、音楽、演出のユニークさ。)
・ ステージ・プレゼンス: 30% (自信、エネルギー、観客を惹きつける力。)

ポップコーンを持ちながら、見逃せないこのイベントを楽しみましょう! 皆さんのご参加をお待ちしています!

Hi Steve,

Thank you for following through.

To clarify a few points:

To my knowledge, all tasks requested by Marcom were completed as instructed. I have not received any communication indicating otherwise- had there been any missing items, I would have addressed them promptly. If there are specific points of concern, I would appreciate the details so I can follow up appropriately.

Regarding the Salsa Night flyers and tickets: since last year, the outlet team has been responsible for printing the tickets in bulk. If this responsibility has changed, I would have appreciated advance notice. As for the flyers, the final menu was only shared with me on Wednesday morning, which made early printing impractical. If there is any uncertainty regarding the current process, I'm happy to clarify directly or alongside the outlet manager.

Concerning the online audit and newsletter: per your written communication-"David can pause on some of his work as it is not pressing"-I prioritized supporting Marcom with the conference. As you know, the audit is normally conducted on Wednesdays, and I had not anticipated being off that day. I would appreciate clearer guidance in the future regarding shifting priorities or expectations so I can align my efforts accordingly.

As for the F&B slides for the communication meeting: I received the assignment on Tuesday and was told on Thursday afternoon that it needed to be completed the same day-while I was still finalizing the name and menu tags for Marcom. Since I received confirmation that Marcom tasks were the priority, I proceeded accordingly.

I understand that our roles demand flexibility, and I've continuously made an effort to be adaptable and cooperative across departments. However, as mentioned in my previous email, the current working environment is increasingly tense and demoralizing. It is affecting my ability to perform effectively in the role I was hired for.
I would ask that expectations around efficiency be set within the context of the environment I am currently navigating.

Please let me know when the meeting you mentioned with the Director of HR will take place, as I believe it's important to address these issues transparently and constructively.
Lastly, I respectfully reject the characterization that I am failing to perform my duties, or that a single sick day accounts for delays in work that spans multiple departments and changing deadlines. I would prefer that facts be carefully checked before such assumptions are made, as responding to these claims is time-consuming and contributes to a distressing work environment.
Please let me know if any further follow-up is needed.

フォローアップありがとうございます。

いくつか点を明確にします：

私の知る限り、マーケコムから要求されたすべてのタスクは指示通りに完了しました。そうでないことを示す連絡は受けていません。もし欠けている項目があれば、迅速に対応したでしょう。具体的な懸念点があれば、適切にフォローアップできるよう詳細をいただけると幸いです。

サルサナイトのチラシとチケットについて：昨年から、チケットの大量印刷はアウトレットチームが担当しています。この責任が変更されたのであれば、事前の通知をいただけるとありがたかったです。チラシについては、最終メニューが水曜日の朝に共有されたため、早期の印刷は現実的ではありませんでした。現在のプロセスについて不明な点があれば、直接またはアウトレットマネージャーと一緒に明確にさせていただきます。

オンライン監査とニュースレターについて：あなたの書面による連絡—「デビッドは、急ぎではない彼の仕事の一部を一時停止できる」—に従い、私はカンファレンスのためのマーケコム支援を優先しました。ご存知のように、監査は通常水曜日に行われ、その日に休むことは予想していませんでした。将来、優先順位や期待値の変更に関してより明確なガイダンスをいただけると、それに応じて努力を調整できます。

コミュニケーションミーティング用のF&Bスライドについて：火曜日に割り当てを受け、木曜日の午後に、マーケコム用の名前とメニュータグを最終決定している最中に、同日中に完了する必要があると告げられました。マーケコムのタスクが優先であるとの確認を受けたため、それに応じて進めました。

私たちの役割が柔軟性を要求することは理解しており、部門間で適応し協力する努力を継続的に行ってきました。しかし、以前のメールで述べたように、現在の労働環境はますます緊張し、士気を低下させています。これは、私が雇われた役割で効果的に遂行する能力に影響を与えています。
私が現在ナビゲートしている環境の文脈の中で、効率に関する期待値を設定していただくようお願いします。

人事部長との会議について、いつ行われるかお知らせください。これらの問題を透明かつ建設的に対処することが重要だと考えています。
最後に、私が職務を遂行できていない、または複数部門にまたがり締め切りが変更される作業の遅延が1日の病欠に起因するという特徴付けを丁重に拒否します。このような仮定をする前に事実を慎重に確認していただきたいと思います。これらの主張に対応することは時間がかかり、苦痛な労働環境に寄与するためです。
さらなるフォローアップが必要かどうかお知らせください。

conversation_flow.body:
Team,

I would like you to start thinking about major events we can host in Table 36 for 2025.

In January, I will schedule some time to discuss, however, I would appreciate you coming with your own ideas.
On the top of my head;

Italian long lunch series
French degustation dinners
Greek festival buffet
Quartet dinner with champagne and caviar etc.

Also, should we do buffets on Sunday nights also? We get a very good spend from this, and a lot of locals love the buffets.
Its a premium venue, so please keep this in mind, we can attract a very good average spend.
Appreciate you taking some time to think on this.

こんにちは、スティーブ。

ご要望に応じて、明確化のために：

-テンプレートが完成した今、これをまとめるのにどれくらい時間がかかりますか？テンプレートはプロセスを効率化するのに役立ちますが、コンテンツは依然として調整、情報収集、デザイン調整が必要です。ニュースレターの作業中に他のことも行っているため、最初の草稿だけでも正確にどれくらい時間がかかるか言うのは難しいです。
-しかし、確認されるまでこれに関する実際の作業はありませんか？ 正解です。作業負荷は確認に依存しますが、主催者とは連絡を取り続けており、今後のプロジェクトと考えています。
-つまりピンクフラミンゴとレトロナイトですか？これらはすでに稼働していますが、これら進行中の作業は何が必要ですか？日付設定とチラシ作成だけですか？マッケンジーが完了しているソーシャル投稿以外の外部マーケティングは必要ないように思われますが？-詳しく説明してください。日付設定、チラシ更新、主催者やパフォーマーとの調整、イベントに応じたその他のタスク（例：一部イベントのチケット作成）。
-10階ロビーでの「可能な」ギャラリーに必要な作業は何ですか- アーティストについて雑誌の人々からの返事を待っているだけではありませんか？いいえ、そうではありません。10階スペースにプロとしてアートを展示したいギャラリーオーナーからの別の提案があります。週末までに彼女の提案を受け取る予定です。
-新しいイベントがない場合、この作業負荷は何ですか- 説明してください まず第一に、新しいイベントはあります。しかし、それらがなくても、定期的なものは依然として更新と調整が必要です。さらに、特別メニューデザインには、中華ワインメニューなど、アウトレットの会場メニューの作業が含まれます。
-これにはどれくらい時間がかかりますか？長いプロセスですか？プロセスはメニューの数、変更が必要かどうか、アップロード後に修正が発生するかどうかによって異なります。ご存知かもしれませんが、通常、小さな修正があります。

取り組んでいるリードを共有してください？Nambar 10のイベントはほとんど確定しているので、他のアウトレットのリードはありますか？レトロナイトとドラァグクイーンショー以外にどのイベントがすでに「ほとんど確定」しているのかわかりません-明確にしてください。他のイベントについては、いくつかのリードに取り組んでおり、より具体的なものに発展したら更新を共有します。東京からのアートイベント（N10 SNSアカウントを通じて連絡）、ファッションイベント（依藤さんと主催者と会議済み）、そしてピンナップイベント（N10の雰囲気に合う）。

「プレッシャーポイント」が何を意味するのか完全にはわかりませんが、特定の点についてさらに明確化が必要な場合はお知らせください。

conversation_flow.subject: Expectations
conversation_flow.body:
David,

To be clear on some expectations moving forward;
-All outlet events are to have digital (TV) signage, at minimum in the foyer by midday on the day of event.
-Cerezo watching events are also included in this
-Hospo night is to be on TV screen as per other events
-TV's and poster material not to be stored in BOH hallways or fire egress
-Flyers and menus/ tickets etc are to be provided to the outlets the day prior to events
-As an F&B representative, you are to wear business attire (suit) when on shift.
-Prior to sending the online platform audit, you are to share with me any non-conformances from outlets so I may address with the managers.
-Clock in and clock out of shift, and for breaks is mandatory and no further allowances on this will be tolerated.
-I would like to see on the Monday of each week, your work list/plan and actionable items, If I am away this is to be presented to Morizono san.
Thank you for understanding, please see me should any of this not be understood.
conversation_flow.body_summary: S. Forrester emails D. Delacruz (cc: HR, Morizono, GM) outlining specific 'expectations moving forward'. These include detailed rules for event signage (timing, types), storage, material delivery timelines, mandatory business attire (suit), pre-reporting audit non-conformances, strict clocking in/out for shifts/breaks ('no further allowances...tolerated'), and mandatory submission of weekly work plans.

デビッド様

While I do have snacks at my desk for that reason, I hope that as a culinary expert, you can appreciate the difference between a snack and a proper meal.
Additionally, regarding the discussion you mentioned about my responsibilities, I have explained my tasks multiple times. incidents.summary_for_lawyers: This lengthy thread (Feb 27-Mar 30) documents S. Forrester imposing strict new work expectations on D. Delacruz, focusing heavily on timekeeping and control. Forrester mandates specific rules (event signage, attire, audit reporting, weekly plans, Feb 27). D. Delacruz seeks clarification on several points (Feb 28). Forrester reiterates demands (Mar 1), specifically imposing a mandatory 12-1pm lunch break and demanding clocking adherence. Forrester then issues a formal warning via email (Mar 15) for D. Delacruz allegedly failing to follow break instructions, citing timecard data and disciplinary matrix terms ('Deserting work station'). D. Delacruz pushes back (Mar 17), questioning the fixed break policy's consistency and raising a medical need (blood sugar) requiring flexible eating times. Forrester dismisses this (Mar 17), demands medical proof, insists D. Delacruz must ask permission (not just inform) for break deviations, and schedules a meeting. D. Delacruz agrees to provide certificate (Mar 18), asks for policy/procedure, and questions the permission requirement again. After D. Delacruz submits certificate (Mar 27), Forrester acknowledges it (Mar 28), uses it to justify the 1pm break time, and instructs submission of original to HR (Mar 30).
potential_indicators_of_power_harassment: Imposing Arbitrary/Inflexible Rules: Mandating a strict 12-1pm lunch break without apparent operational need, especially after employee raises medical concerns requiring flexibility.
Micromanagement/Excessive Scrutiny: Detailed monitoring of break times (citing timecard data), mandatory weekly work plans, specific attire requirements, rigid clocking rules.
Disregarding Medical Needs: Initially dismissing medical concerns, demanding proof, and using the provided certificate to reinforce the rigid break schedule rather than accommodate.
Inconsistent Application of Policy (Alleged): D. Delacruz claims the fixed break/permission requirement is not applied to others in similar roles.
Threats/Intimidation: Explicitly referencing the disciplinary matrix ('Deserting work station', 'Refusal to carry out lawful instructions') for minor deviations from newly imposed, rigid break rules.
Dismissive/Authoritarian Communication: Forrester's tone ('What part... do you not understand?', 'Let's put this to rest and start to follow instructions').
Targeted Focus: The intense focus on D. Delacruz's timekeeping and adherence to newly specified rules, especially regarding breaks, appears targeted.

conversation_flow.subject: Concerns Regarding Workplace Environment and Managerial Conduct
conversation_flow.body:
Dear Shane,

I hope this email finds you well. I am reaching out to share my concerns about the recent changes in the work environment, which I believe have negatively impacted my ability to perform my job effectively and have created a challenging work environment. I believe that the quality of the work environment should improve over time as we grow and adapt, but unfortunately, I feel that this has not been the case recently. While I am highly flexible and always strive to adjust my schedule and workload to meet what is required as demonstrated by my willingness to take on new responsibilities when asked or change my schedule suddenly if needed the current situation is not.
For example, despite properly communicating a schedule change with another manager in the same department, I was reprimanded unfairly upon arrival.
Furthermore, I've recently learned that my manager has spoken negatively about me to some colleagues, which has caused unnecessary tension and discomfort in the workplace.

conversation_flow.subject: RE: Concerns Regarding Workplace Environment and Managerial Conduct
conversation_flow.body:
Dear David,

Thank you for your email and making me aware of your current situation. I assume by your email your "manager" you are currently referring to Steve in which you now report. While I will not share your email with Steve as per your request I am happy to speak with him directly understanding the sensitivity of your concerns which I can assure you that there will not be any recourse from this discussion.
While you have communicated your concerns I would like to take this opportunity to provide you with feedback on the potentially why. Steve and other leaders have felt that they need to micro manage which may give the impression of concerns in working environment. As leaders we are required to provide structure and ensure we are fair and equitable across all our team so that we create a fair environment across all areas of the hotel.
It is no secret that there has been frustration with some areas of your work which has meant that more attention and less freedom has been placed on you in recent times as we look deeper into your productivity and set "must have" guidelines so that the business and those leaders can meet their objectives.
I have listed some real concerns that I am happy to discuss with you in more detail:

Punctual and absenteeism: There have been a number of occasions that we are not sure if and when you will be attending work or you will turn up at a scheduled start time, Your communication of absenteeism is often not communicated directly to your manager but rather through other employees who are not your report. This is not acceptable with any other employee so this should not be expected from you either which I know drives frustration with leaders including Steve and Angela who have often tried to defend this type of behavior. Unfortunately it is common that some of the team will jokingly make comment if you will be attending work or not driving frustration in the leadership team.
Meeting deadline and follow up: While we have seen some improvement recently constant follow up and frustration that essential audits are not completed on time and communication is often not followed through to ensure works are not completed on time. This has an adverse effect on both the business and leaders when questioned why these are not done in turn, potentially impacting the work environment through their frustration.
Blurred lines between work and socializing: While we understand part of your role is to organize an coordinate F&B events in which we have had some success I know what frustrates some of the leadership team and the operational team and the question of is David working or is he not working is raised. Often this can be very confusing to the team and when the leaders are questioned I know drives frustration and in some case resentment from others within the team. It is important that this needs to be defined with clear definition between the two which is sometimes the case with our marketing team.

I am sorry if any of the above may not have been communicated to you directly I am happy to address these with you in case there is some misunderstanding, I am sure if we can put some firm structure in place and basics such as communication, working to a schedule, attending work on time which are the basics of any employees roles this will go a long way in resolving the tension that you may be experiencing in your work environment. We do not condone any inappropriate behavior such as threats in the work place and should this be the case I will take this up with the manager concerned.
David, when you are meeting the requirements of what is a fluid role and we are able to meet hotel targets that you have contributed then I know the work environment is a much better place and is very enjoyable. It will be important that moving forward all parties firstly meet the obligations and expectations of the hotel and specific roles we are all employed for. Once these have been achieved that this allows us more time for creative freedom and thinking outside of the box mentality in which you work well in.

As mentioned I will speak with Steve directly however would also like a separate conversation with you so that you can express any further grievances and we can address the points raised. We have an exciting year ahead in our F&B space which you are a major contributor so it is important we address all concerned for future operations.

Apologizes if feedback wasn't direct. Suggests structure/basics (communication, schedule, punctuality) will resolve tension. States threats are not condoned and will be taken up. Links better environment to meeting requirements/targets. Affirms D. Delacruz is major F&B contributor. Repeats intent to speak with Steve and offers separate meeting with D. Delacruz for further grievances.

デビッド様

メールをいただき、現在の状況を知らせてくれてありがとうございます。メールから、あなたが現在報告している「マネージャー」はスティーブのことだと推測します。あなたのリクエストに基づき、このメールをスティーブと共有しませんが、あなたの懸念の機密性を理解した上で直接彼と話すことは喜んで行います。この話し合いから何らかの報復がないことを保証します。
懸念を伝えていただきましたが、この機会に、その潜在的な理由についてフィードバックを提供したいと思います。スティーブや他のリーダーたちは、マイクロマネジメントが必要だと感じており、それが職場環境の懸念という印象を与えているのかもしれません。リーダーとして、私たちは構造を提供し、チーム全体で公正かつ公平であることを保証し、ホテル全体のすべてのエリアで公正な環境を作り出す必要があります。
あなたの仕事のいくつかの分野で不満があったことは周知の事実であり、それが最近、生産性をより深く調査し、「必須」ガイドラインを設定する中で、あなたにより多くの注意が払われ、自由が少なくなったことを意味します。これにより、ビジネスとそれらのリーダーが目標を達成できます。
詳細についてあなたと話し合うことを嬉しく思ういくつかの実際の懸念事項をリストアップしました：

時間厳守と欠勤：あなたがいつ出勤するか、または予定された開始時間に出勤するかわからない場合が何度かありました。あなたの欠勤の連絡は、しばしばマネージャーに直接ではなく、あなたの報告対象ではない他の従業員を通じて行われます。これは他のどの従業員にも受け入れられないため、あなたからも期待されるべきではありません。これがスティーブやアンジェラを含むリーダーたちの不満を引き起こしていることを知っています。彼らはしばしばこの種の行動を擁護しようとしてきました。残念ながら、チームの一部があなたが出勤するかどうかについて冗談めかしてコメントし、リーダーシップチームの不満を引き起こすことはよくあります。
締め切りとフォローアップの遵守：最近いくつかの改善が見られましたが、本質的な監査が時間通りに完了せず、作業が時間通りに完了しないことを確実にするためのコミュニケーションがしばしばフォローされないという絶え間ないフォローアップと不満があります。これは、なぜこれらが順番に行われないのかと質問されたときに、ビジネスとリーダーの両方に悪影響を及ぼし、彼らの不満を通じて職場環境に影響を与える可能性があります。これが完全にあなたの責任ではないことに同意しますが、あなたはこれらのタスクを監視する上で主要な役割を果たしており、時間通りかつ正確に行われれば、運営とリーダーがビジネスの他の分野に集中できるようになり、チームとしてうまく機能します。
仕事と社交の境界線の曖昧さ：あなたの役割の一部がF&Bイベントの企画調整であり、いくつかの成功を収めていることを理解していますが、リーダーシップチームと運営チームの一部を苛立たせるもの、そしてデビッドは働いているのか、働いていないのかという疑問が提起されることを知っています。これはしばしばチームにとって非常に混乱を招き、リーダーが質問されたとき、チーム内の他の人々からの不満、場合によっては憤りを引き起こすことを知っています。マーケティングチームの場合のように、両者の間に明確な定義でこれを定義することが重要です。

上記のいずれかが直接伝えられなかった場合は申し訳ありません。誤解がある場合に備えて、これらについてあなたと話し合うことを嬉しく思います。コミュニケーション、スケジュール通りの作業、時間通りの出勤といった基本事項など、しっかりとした構造と基本を整備できれば、職場環境で経験しているかもしれない緊張を解決するのに大いに役立つと確信しています。職場での脅迫などの不適切な行動は容認せず、もしそうであれば、関係するマネージャーに提起します。
デビッド、あなたが流動的な役割の要件を満たし、貢献したホテルの目標を達成できるとき、職場環境はずっと良くなり、非常に楽しいものであることを知っています。今後は、すべての当事者がまずホテルと私たちが皆雇用されている特定の役割の義務と期待を満たすことが重要になります。これらが達成されれば、あなたがうまく機能する創造的な自由と思考の枠を超えるためのより多くの時間が得られます。

述べたように、スティーブと直接話しますが、さらに不満を表明し、提起された点に対処できるよう、あなたとの別の会話も希望します。私たちのF&Bスペースにはエキサイティングな年が待っており、あなたは主要な貢献者ですので、将来の運営のためにすべての懸念事項に対処することが重要です。

conversation_flow.subject: Re: Concerns Regarding Workplace Environment and Managerial Conduct
conversation_flow.body:
Dear Shane,

Thank you for taking the time to respond to my email. I appreciate your willingness to engage on these issues and your acknowledgment of the situation's complexity. While I understand that changes in management styles can naturally bring challenges, my concern goes beyond time adjustments, tasks, or minor tensions. Over time, I've heard comments from colleagues attributed to Steve that were concerning. Although I initially chose to remain professional and focus on my work to avoid creating discomfort in the workplace, a specific false statement Steve claimed I made about a colleague made it much harder to do so. Such inaccurate statements have the potential to harm my reputation and may already have and hearing additional negative comments left me questioning what else might have been said and to whom. This uncertainty has significantly impacted my focus and motivation.

I wish I could provide more details about the nature of these comments, but I am mindful of protecting my colleagues and avoiding unnecessary conflict. From my understanding of similar cases in Japan, maintaining anonymity when disclosing such information is often crucial for both fairness and resolution. Even after hearing the false statement, I tried to remain professional and shifted much of my communication through Morizono-san, who I understand is also my manager. However, the situation escalated when a minor change in the schedule one I had clearly communicated-led to Steve approaching me in a confrontational and aggressive manner, yelling at me before even seeking clarification. The situation became worse on Saturday Jan 11th, when Steve made remarks implying that my job might be at risk if my performance didn't improve. While I welcome constructive feedback and always strive to grow professionally, the perceived threat of termination has added immense pressure and made me realize that ignoring Steve's comments and focusing solely on my work does not guarantee a safe or supportive environment. Making it increasingly difficult to see how I can continue contributing to my best potential under the current circumstances..

I appreciate your efforts to address this matter, and I trust your judgment in finding a way forward, which I know realize is hard without Steve realizing I spoke up about his concerning behavior. Sadly, working with him now is a challenge, which makes it difficult to perform at my best and improve at my work because I cannot even concentrate or speak openly. More than the challenges at work, the constant mental stress is even affecting my life outside of work and health, so I really hope to solve this situation promptly in a way that upholds the company's values. I'm happy to meet with you to discuss this in more detail and work toward a resolution. Thank you!

Argues perceived threat adds pressure and focusing on work isn't enough for safety/support. States difficulty working with Steve hampers performance/concentration/openness. Notes constant mental stress affecting health/life outside work. Expresses desire for prompt resolution upholding company values and willingness to meet.

conversation_flow.body:
Dear Shane,

Thank you for taking the time to discuss the situation earlier. I wanted to follow up to clarify my perspective and share my usual schedule for your reference.
First, I understand why you feel knowing the specifics of the alleged comments is necessary. However, as I mentioned, the information was shared with me in confidence, and I am committed to protecting my colleague's anonymity to avoid potential repercussions for them.
That said, 1 recognize the seriousness of this matter and want to find a constructive solution. As I mentioned, an option I am considering is involving a neutral third party, such as a mediator or legal professional, to whom my colleagues would be willing to provide their account. This would allow the validity of the statement to be confirmed while maintaining their confidentiality, which I think is pertinent to the situation.
Regarding my schedule:

On weekends with events, I typically work from noon to 8:30 PM and take a day off on Tuesday or Wednesday, depending on meetings. This week, there's no event on Saturday, but there is one on Sunday, along with a meeting for a potential big event. I would prefer to take Friday off as a rest day.

Next week, we have the Drag Queen Show on Saturday. For next month, there are events on every Saturday, as well as special events on the 14th and 28th.
Once again, thanks for your time today!

conversation_flow.subject: RE: Concerns Regarding Workplace Environment and Managerial Conduct
conversation_flow.body:
Dear David,

As discussed I am not sure on what you feel will happen should you or other teams raise a concern, any repercussions that you feel will happen is against Accor's policy and is not tolerated by the hotel or our company. I can assure you should any such behavior occur from any employee this will be dealt with swiftly in line with those Accor policies.
I would encourage you to ask those employees to come forward if there is genuine concerns so that any allegations can be thoroughly investigated inline with Accor's grievance policies. As mentioned all employees have the right to defend any allegation following a thorough investigation.
With regards to rosters and mentioned in our discussions it is important that we add more structure into your schedule so that as a business we operate efficiently and effectively while allowing you to meet your obligations of your role. Moving forward in the short term I will be providing you with your schedule including your start and finish times. This will provide you with more clarity and I can then communicate to the team and those leaders that you have interaction with so that you are present at those required moments.
I will draft this in 7 shifts in which you need to ensure you have access, should these shifts need to change please send through you request for review, also if there are appointments that you need to attend then please let me know. To make sure I do not miss any of those appointments I will send through a request so I have access to your Outlook appointment calendar in which all appointments will be added. This will also assist me to ensure you have adequate support should you require others to attend those meetings.
To ensure I draft your roster in line with your contract and the labor law I need to re confirm your past working days in January, I will cc you in with Shimizu san for a copy of your attendance record.
Please let me know if you have any additional questions and allow me time to write your roster in 7 shifts for the coming weeks. (I will also provide you with separate copy as in the past you mentioned you have trouble accessing 7 shifts) Once this is done I will then communicate to the team on your behalf.

Encourages colleagues with concerns to come forward for investigation per grievance policies, noting right to defense. States need for more 'structure' in D. Delacruz's schedule for business efficiency. Announces he (Edwards) will provide D. Delacruz's schedule short-term, including start/finish times, for clarity and communication to team/leaders. Will use 7shifts, requires D. Delacruz ensure access, requests changes via review request, asks for notification of appointments. Will request Outlook calendar access to track appointments and ensure support. Will request Jan attendance record from A. Shimizu (Payroll/HR?) to draft roster compliant with contract/law. Asks D. Delacruz to allow time for roster creation, promises separate copy due to past 7shifts access issues.

デビッド様

話し合ったように、あなたや他のチームが懸念を提起した場合に何が起こると感じているかわかりません。あなたが感じているいかなる報復もAccorのポリシーに反し、ホテルや当社では容認されません。いかなる従業員からそのような行動が発生した場合、それらのAccorポリシーに沿って迅速に対処することを保証します。
もし真の懸念があるなら、それらの従業員に名乗り出るよう奨励します。そうすれば、Accorの苦情処理ポリシーに沿って、いかなる申し立ても徹底的に調査できます。述べたように、すべての従業員は徹底的な調査の後、いかなる申し立ても弁護する権利を持っています。
勤務表に関して、そして私たちの議論で述べたように、ビジネスとして効率的かつ効果的に運営し、あなたが役割の義務を果たすことができるように、あなたのスケジュールにより多くの構造を追加することが重要です。短期的には、開始時刻と終了時刻を含むあなたのスケジュールを提供します。これにより、あなたにより明確さが提供され、その後、あなたが交流を持つチームやリーダーたちに必要な瞬間にあなたが存在するように伝えることができます。
これを7shiftsで草稿しますので、アクセスを確認する必要があります。これらのシフトを変更する必要がある場合は、レビューのためにリクエストを送ってください。また、出席する必要がある予約がある場合はお知らせください。それらの予約を見逃さないように、すべての予約が追加されるOutlook予約カレンダーへのアクセス権をリクエストします。これはまた、それらの会議に他の人が出席する必要がある場合に、適切なサポートを確保するのに役立ちます。
あなたの契約と労働法に準拠して勤務表を作成するために、1月の過去の勤務日を再確認する必要があります。あなたの出席記録のコピーについて、清水さんとあなたをCCに入れます。
追加の質問があればお知らせください。そして、今後の数週間の勤務表を7shiftsで作成するための時間をください。（過去に7shiftsへのアクセスに問題があると述べたため、別途コピーも提供します）これが完了したら、あなたに代わってチームに伝えます。

He requests confidentiality from Forrester initially. Edwards responds (Jan 13), acknowledging Steve as the manager, assuring no recourse from discussing with Steve. Aggressive Communication: D. Delacruz alleges Forrester approached him 'in a confrontational and aggressive manner, yelling'.
Spreading Negative Comments/False Statements: Allegation Forrester spoke negatively to colleagues and made a false statement attributed to D. Delacruz.

Imposing Control After Complaint: Immediately after D. Delacruz details serious allegations and expresses fear, Edwards imposes increased structure and monitoring (taking over scheduling, demanding calendar access, requesting attendance records), potentially creating a more controlled/pressured environment rather than addressing the reported behavior.
Ignoring Proposed Solutions: Edwards seems to ignore D. Delacruz's suggestion of third-party mediation in his final response.

Dear Jade,

Thank you for clarifying the format and participants for the upcoming investigation meeting. I appreciate the effort to ensure transparency in this process.

Regarding the submission of evidence, I want to confirm the following:

conversation_flow.body:
ハーティストの皆さんへ、

お疲れ様です。
新年あけましておめでとうございます。
添付のファイルに、1月のトレーニングカレンダーをお送りいたします。今月のトレーニングセッションの予定をご確認ください。
遅れてのご案内となり、申し訳ございません。

スムーズな調整と正確な出席管理のため、以下の点にご注意ください:
・ 出席登録は、部署のマネージャーまたはセクションリーダーの承認が必要です。
・トレーニングへの参加を希望される方は、必ずマネージャーに相談し、承認を受けてください。その後、マネージャーまたは部署の秘書が出席者を登録します。
・ 出席登録シートのリンクは以下に記載しておりますが、マネージャー、秘書、または指定された代表者のみが登録を行うようにしてください:
\\10.138.128.235\General\January Training

このプロセスは、参加人数の管理を徹底し、トレーニング参加が運営上の目標に沿った形で行われるようにするためのものです。
カレンダーや登録プロセスに関してご質問がありましたら、どうぞお気軽にお問い合わせください。
ご協力いただきありがとうございます。1月も実りあるトレーニング月間となることを楽しみにしています。
よろしくお願いいたします。

Dear Heartists,

Happy New Year!

Attached, you will find the January Training Calendar outlining the training sessions planned for this month. Apologies for the delay in sharing this with you.
To ensure smooth coordination and proper attendance tracking, please note the following:
• Staff attendance must be approved by your department manager or section head before being added to the attendance sheets.
If you are interested in attending a session, please discuss it with your manager, who can sign you up or coordinate with your department secretary to do so.
• The link to the attendance signup sheet is provided below, but only managers, secretaries, or their designated representatives should input names:
\\10.138.128.235\General\January Training

This process helps us manage capacity and ensure that training attendance supports our operational goals. If you have any questions about the calendar or the signup process, please feel free to reach out.
Thank you for your cooperation, and I look forward to a successful training month ahead.
conversation_flow.body_summary: E. Lat (L&D Manager) emails all staff distributing the January Training Calendar (attached, link provided). Apologizes for delay. Outlines signup process: requires manager approval, managers/secretaries handle registration via provided link to manage capacity and align with operational goals.

Hi Steve,

Thank you for noting that, it definitely went well.
As requested, here is a detailed breakdown of the meeting:

The event organizer, Hi-san, arrived earlier at the hotel, and after meeting her in the lobby, I took her to the outlet where she would like to hold the event, NAMBAR10. I showed her NAMBAR10, explained the concept of the restaurant, and showed her the food and drink menu until Yorifuji-san arrived.
During the meeting, we discussed the usual points covered in event meetings and gathered the following details:
• Event Name: Pink Cherry Party
Theme: Spring (chance to meet new people) and Cosmetology (she is inviting a well-known Japanese cosmetologist who will hold a Q&A session, a makeup seminar, and private makeup sessions).
• Projected ROI: Still in preliminary discussion. The estimated ROI is being determined based on venue capacity and expected turnout, with an estimated 30-50 guests.
Marketing Initiatives: Still under discussion, as the event has not been approved yet.
• Time: Initially planned for the evening to match the vibe of the other event, but during the meeting, we also discussed the possibility of holding it at noon.
Ticketing/Pricing: The final price has not been decided, but the expected pricing is ¥4,000 for women and ¥8,000 for men, including one drink.
Food: NAMBAR10 menu + small dishes, similar to what we offer for Retro Night.

As you mentioned, Yorifuji-san had another meeting at 16:00, so she left around 16:05. No additional details about the event were shared after that. Hi-san stayed a bit longer to confirm some of the discussed points and take pictures/videos of the venue. If you would like to confirm that, feel free to ask Angela or Kenzie, as they were also in NAMBAR10 for a different meeting at that time.
Since Hi-san is involved in a wide range of events, from formal dinners to seminars, I briefly showed her Minami Teppanyaki Restaurant, Hana-Goyomi, and Table36 before she left.
I did not check the exact time she left, but it was around 16:30, as you mentioned.

Regarding future event meetings, I will ensure that both you and Shimizu-san are invited, since most event organizers are Japanese, and proper translation will be required for decisions to be made accordingly.
There is no problem if you cannot respond within the working day, but please do not expect me to provide a detailed breakdown by 10 AM when my shift starts at 9 AM. As I hope you are aware, I have other tasks that took priority, and this was a time-consuming task as well.
Let me know if you need any more details.

Hi team,

Regarding outlet event bookings, please ensure all correspondence has Davids inclusion, with myself CC'd in.

Moving forward any events, with entertainment or special arrangements, will be required to sign off on an entertainment agreement form (attached) with as much detail as possible, in order to ensure we are making commercially viable decisions when it comes to hosting them.
I appreciate there are already a few under way or in the works, and I am happy to meet with the supplier to discuss the new procedure.
Please also ensure, once the agreement is signed off by all relevant parties, that you include the event in the promotional matrix worksheets.
This will ensure visibility and also no overlap.

I appreciate there are a lot of new practices/procedures, however, this will ideally streamline your workings and see more profitable outlets/ events.
Please see me should you have any queries.

Delacruz ('Davids inclusion') be included in all correspondence, with Forrester himself cc'd. Requires a detailed 'entertainment agreement form' (attached) be signed off for events with entertainment/special arrangements for commercial viability. Offers to meet suppliers about the new procedure. Requires signed-off events be added to promotional matrix for visibility/avoiding overlap. Acknowledges new procedures aim to streamline and increase profitability.

Urgency/Tone: The use of multiple exclamation points ('!!!!') conveys excessive urgency or potential frustration regarding survey completion.

conversation_flow.subject: F&B RevMAX slides
conversation_flow.body:
Hi David,

Please share the plans for EDMs for the next 30-45 days. Also, please share challenges if any with regards to the online channels in a couple of slides. Please share it with me by tomorrow morning.
conversation_flow.body_summary: J. Kannan (Revenue Director) emails D. Delacruz (cc: Edwards, Forrester, Silvestre) requesting input for F&B RevMAX slides: EDM plans for next 30-45 days and any online channel challenges. Asks for submission by 'tomorrow morning'.
conversation_flow.body_JA:
こんにちは、デビッド。

今後30～45日間のEDMの計画を共有してください。また、オンラインチャネルに関する課題があれば、数枚のスライドで共有してください。明日の朝までに私と共有してください。
conversation_flow.body_summary_JA: J. Kannan氏（レベニューディレクター）がD. Delacruz氏にメール（cc: Edwards氏, Forrester氏, Silvestre氏）。F&B RevMAXスライドへの入力を要請：今後30～45日間のEDM計画、およびオンラインチャネルに関する課題。 「明日の朝まで」に提出を依頼。

conversation_flow.subject: Re: F&B RevMAX slides
conversation_flow.body:
Hi Jayesh,

I will create a EDM schedule for tablecheck after getting the information from the managers about the timeline of the menu. They will complete that by next week.

As challenges you mean why some people might not book in that specific channel? Or challenges when updating and keeping them going?

Will update you on next week meeting if I find any!
conversation_flow.body_summary: D. Delacruz replies to J. Kannan. States he will create EDM schedule after getting menu timeline info from managers (expected next week). Asks for clarification on 'challenges' (booking barriers or updating difficulties?). Says he will update on challenges at next week's meeting if any found.
conversation_flow.body_JA:
こんにちは、ジェイエッシュ。

メニューのタイムラインに関する情報をマネージャーから入手した後、テーブルチェック用のEDMスケジュールを作成します。彼らは来週までにそれを完了します。

課題として、特定のチャネルで一部の人々が予約しない理由を意味しますか？それとも、更新や維持における課題ですか？

何か見つかれば、来週の会議で更新します！
conversation_flow.body_summary_JA: D. Delacruz氏がJ. Kannan氏に返信。マネージャーからメニュータイムライン情報（来週予定）を得た後、EDMスケジュールを作成すると述べる。「課題」について明確化を求める（予約障壁か更新困難か？）。何か見つかれば来週の会議で課題について更新すると言う。

conversation_flow.subject: Re: F&B RevMAX slides
conversation_flow.body:

Yes, it could be booking challenges or challenges in updating etc. Or issues with certain channels.
The meeting is tomorrow. So do update if you have something.
conversation_flow.body_summary: J. Kannan clarifies 'challenges' could include booking issues, updating issues, or specific channel problems. Reminds D. Delacruz the meeting is 'tomorrow' and asks for an update if he has anything.
conversation_flow.body_JA:
こんにちは、デビッド。

はい、予約の課題や更新の課題などである可能性があります。または特定のチャネルの問題。
会議は明日です。何かあれば更新してください。

Has been a positive couple of weeks, finding traction and improvements thus far.

こんにちは、ジェイエッシュ。

フォローアップありがとうございます。
今週それらに取り組みます。
話し合ったように、レストランマネージャーもコミュニケーションに含めます。

conversation_flow.subject: Re: F&B RevMAX slides
conversation_flow.body:
Team,

After some feedback, what else would you add in?
Angela/David- would require you to have input on marketing and events pages.
-perhaps promo activity/ discounted offers etc.
Morizono, would require you to have input on snapshot and opportunities.
Jayesh, would appreciate your support in focusing on revenue generation, rather than simply being reactive.
Will need to ensure the meeting is kept on track and leave room for discussion as the outlet managers will take some time getting used to.
Also conscious that everyone has multiple meetings to prepare for, so don't want to overload it.
Appreciate you're advice before I work with Shane on final.
conversation_flow.body_summary: S. Forrester emails the core team (Kannan, Delacruz, Silvestre, Morizono) asking for further input on the RevMAX presentation slides (attached). Specifically requests input from 'Angela/David' on marketing/events pages (promos), from Morizono on snapshot/opportunities, and asks Kannan to focus on revenue generation. Acknowledges need to manage meeting time and workload. Asks for advice before finalizing with Shane Edwards.
conversation_flow.body_JA:
チームへ

いくつかのフィードバックの後、他に何を追加しますか？
アンジェラ/デビッド - マーケティングとイベントページへの入力が必要です。
-おそらくプロモーション活動/割引オファーなど。
森園さん、スナップショットと機会への入力が必要です。
ジェイエッシュさん、単に反応的であるのではなく、収益創出に焦点を当てるサポートをいただけると幸いです。
アウトレットマネージャーが慣れるのに時間がかかるため、会議が軌道に乗っていることを確認し、議論の余地を残す必要があります。
また、誰もが準備すべき複数の会議があることを認識しているので、過負荷にしたくありません。
シェーンと最終決定に取り組む前に、あなたのアドバイスに感謝します。
conversation_flow.body_summary_JA: S. Forrester氏がコアチーム（Kannan氏、Delacruz氏、Silvestre氏、Morizono氏）にメールし、RevMAXプレゼンテーションスライド（添付）へのさらなる入力を求める。具体的には「アンジェラ/デビッド」にマーケティング/イベントページ（プロモ）、Morizono氏にスナップショット/機会、Kannan氏に収益創出への注力を要請。会議時間と作業負荷管理の必要性を認識。Shane Edwards氏との最終決定前にアドバイスを求める。
